This is the "circuit type" of the emulated router It defines the type of adjacency that Spirent TestCenter establishes with the SUT
Defines Network type of ISIS interface
On broadcast networks, router priority is used to determine which router should act as the designated router
Area address (3- to 14-octet address) Spirent TestCenter supports up to three addresses per emulated router Area 1 address is mandatory
1-octet Hex identifier of the emulated router interface (Applies to non-Ethernet connections only. This field is blank and disabled for Ethernet ports.)
Specifies how often (in seconds) an emulated router sends hello PDUs to ISIS neighbors (Actual interval is 7.5 to 10 sec hello interval - random jitter = actual send time)

Number by which the intermediate system multiplies the hello interval to calculate hold time, which is the period a router waits without seeing a hello from the sending router before it considers the sending router to be down
Enable/Disable BFD Parameters for the test
Time unit for all time interval configuration properties
Minimum interval that the emulated router wants between transmitted BFD Control packets
Minimum interval that the emulated router wants between received BFD Control packets
Value to multiply the negotiated transmit interval by to calculate the detection time for the transmitting system in Asynchronous mode
Number Of Routers in the topology
Emulated router's position within the topology
Start of IPv4 Route Router ID
Start of IPv4 Route System ID
IPv4 Route Prefix Length Distribution Type

test_properties.description: Start of IPv4 Routes Prefix Length

Time (in seconds) to wait for the protocol to establish
Time (in seconds) to wait before starting traffic
Maximum Threshold (in microseconds) used to validate stream convergence
Event type to trigger the start of convergence
Enable/Disable Restore Trigger Event for the test
Time (in seconds) to wait before stopping traffic
Restore Trigger Event type for the test
